H0.text: Into the heart is where air goes when a person breathes in.

H1.text: Into the stomach is where air goes when a person breathes in.

H2.text: Into the lungs is where air goes when a person breathes in.

H3.text: Into the liver is where air goes when a person breathes in.

A4.text: During inhalation air enters the trachea via the nostrils and mouth, and continues to just beyond the syrinx at which point the trachea branches into two primary bronchi, going to the two lungs (Fig. 16).
